column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Na3Co2SbO6 was synthesized by con-\rventional solid state reaction.
#Text=The starting materials\rNa2CO3 (99.995%, Alfa Aesar), Co3O4 (99.7%, Alfa Ae-\rsar), and Sb2O3 (99.9%, Alfa Aesar) were mixed in the\rmolar ratio of 1.65:0.67:0.5.
#Text=A 10% excess Na2CO3 was\radded to compensate the evaporation loss during sinter-\ring.
#Text=The homogeneous powder was pelletized and then\rplaced in an alumina crucible with a lid and heated to\r800\C in 20 hrs and held at this temperature for 48 hrs.
#Text=The resulting product was ground and pelletized again and heated to 900\C and held there for 48 hrs before\rcooling to room temperature.
#Text=Room temperature x-ray\rpowder diraction con\frmed that the sample is single\rphase after the second sintering.
#Text=The re\fnement of all\rpowder diraction patterns in this work is performed us-\ring the monoclinic C2/m structure following ref[14, 15]\rand our single crystal x-ray diraction study.
#Text=The lattice\rparameters from Rietveld re\fnement are a=5.3557(8) \A,\rb=9.2701(10) \A, c=5.6486(6) \A, and \f=108.40(2)\.
#Text=The\rlattice parameters are comparable to those reported by\rWong et al.[15]\rA dense pellet of Na3Zn2SbO6 was also synthesized us-\ring a similar procedure.
#Text=The temperature dependence of\rspeci\fc heat of Na3Zn2SbO6 was used as the phonon ref-\rerence when estimating the entropy release across mag-\rnetic order of Na3Co2SbO6.
